conversation.content: [bitter] Lo han hecho de verdad. Diez años después y por fin—Dios, por fin han admitido que no fui yo. [laugh] Pensarías que estaría contenta, ¿no? [pause] O sea, lo estoy, pero... mi hija, ella em, me llamó "señora" cuando aparecí. [very sad] Tenía siete años cuando entré. [shaky voice] Ahora tiene 17, y ni siquiera me conoce. [sigh] Mi mujer—exmujer, supongo—se volvió a casar el año pasado. [quietly] Buen tío, por lo visto. Cuida de ellas. [angry] ¿Y se supone que tengo que estar qué, agradecida? [frustrated] ¿Que otro haya criado a mi hija mientras yo me pudría ahí dentro por algo que ni siquiera hice? [long pause] Mamá murió hace 3 años. [whispering] Ni siquiera me dijeron que estaba enferma. [upset] Dijeron que no querían, eh... no querían agobiarme con eso. [sarcastic] Agobiarme. Como si tuviera otro sitio donde estar. [cry] Mi hermano, no para de decir "creíamos que lo habías hecho." [furious] ¡Creíamos que lo habías hecho! [exhausted] ¿Cómo se... cómo vuelves de eso? [trailing off] Todo el mundo ha seguido adelante y yo estoy aquí como... [very melancholic] Soy un fantasma paseándose por una vida que ya no existe.

original_conversation.content: [bitter] They actually did it. Ten years later and they finally—God, they finally admitted I didn't do it. [laugh] You'd think I'd be happy, right? [pause] I mean, I am, but... my daughter, she um, she called me "sir" when I showed up. [very sad] She was seven when I went in. [shaky voice] Seventeen now, and she doesn't even know me. [sigh] My wife—ex-wife, I guess—she remarried last year. [quietly] Good guy, apparently. Takes care of them. [angry] And I'm supposed to be what, grateful? [frustrated] That someone else raised my kid while I rotted in there for something I didn't even do? [long pause] Mom died three years ago. [whispering] They didn't even tell me she was sick. [upset] Said they didn't want to, er... didn't want to burden me with it. [sarcastic] Burden me. Like I had somewhere else to be. [cry] My brother, he just keeps saying "we thought you did it." [furious] We thought you did it! [exhausted] How do you even... how do you come back from that? [trailing off] Everyone's moved on and I'm just... [very melancholic] I'm this ghost walking around in a life that doesn't exist anymore.

subject: Your exonerated status finally came through after ten years in prison, but your family has moved on without you
